title: Karen Matthews 'made money in prison by writing letters'
text: comments Karen Matthews (pictured) was jailed for eight years after faking her own daughter's kidnap Karen Matthews is alleged to have written explicit letters to admirers who sent her money while she was serving time in prison. The mother-of-seven was jailed after she claimed her daughter Shannon had been kidnapped after going missing from her home in Dewsbury, West Yorkshire. She was found one month later at a home just a few miles from Dewsbury which belonged to the uncle of Craig Meehan who was Ms Matthews' boyfriend. And a source has now told Sun Online that Ms Matthews wrote a number of letters and sent them to admirers who would give her money. She ended up in prison after being convicted of kidnapping, false imprisonment, and perverting the course of justice and was jailed for eight years. Ms Matthews was jailed along with Michael Donovan, Mr Meehan's uncle, and served time in New Hall prison in West Yorkshire and Foston Hall prison in Derbyshire. The source also claimed that while in prison, she planned to win over a guard and try to become pregnant, reports Ellie Cambridge at the Sun Online . They said: 'Her money came from male pen pal fans of hers who she wrote dirty letters to and they sent her money in return.' Ms Matthews (left) allegedly wrote dirty letters to admirers when she ended up in prison after claiming her daughter Shannon (right) had been kidnapped The source also claimed that Ms Matthews was given stamps to write to her children but chose to exchange them for cigarettes. They added: 'She got loads of letters from male inmates in other prisons too and became pen pals with a guy in Wakefield prison who was doing life.' It comes as the first episode about her daughter's disappearance was aired on the BBC earlier this week. The drama, called The Moorside, stars actress Sheridan Smith and revisits the kidnap case which happened almost one decade ago. It comes as a BBC drama about the case, called The Moorside (pictured), was aired earlier this week Ms Matthews was released from prison after serving half of her eight-year sentence. Meanwhile, Shannon's childhood best friend has spoken of her anger towards the Ms Matthews who betrayed the community which rallied around her in 2008. Speaking for the first time on ITV's This Morning, Callie Brown, 18, revealed she has not seen or spoken to her best friend in nine years following the faked kidnap. When asked how she felt when the betrayal was revealed, Callie said: 'I was mostly angry. I wanted to punch Karen. How could your own mother do something so cruel? It's not natural. It's unreal.'
